page.title: 05WATER SUPPLY
page.content:
Jersey's population has almost {doubled}since 1939 to almost 80000 and this has brought major problems for the major services. The{water supply} in the early 1970s came from {reservoirs}supplemented in the height of summer and the tourist season from the{Desalination Plant}near La Corbiere. There are only a limited number of valleys in an island the size of Jersey and some of the remaining valleys were particularly unspoilt in an increasingly built-up environment.
In 1975, the{Waterworks Company } (then completely private but now with some public representation) proposed to flood a valley in the east of the island. As if to bear out the need for this, the major{drought of 1976} emphasized the summer supply problem.
